name: 寫作指導（二）
restrict: ◎限大一修習◎必須先修過【ENU0237  寫作指導（一）】
description: This two-semester course is to help students develop their ability to properly express themselves in written English. In the first semester, students are expected to acquire the fundamentals of English paragraph-writing, including structure (topic sentence, controlling idea, support and conclusion), outline, organization and coherence. In the second semester, students will extend their one-paragraph writing skills to three-paragraph short-essay writing. In addition, this course aims to equip students with analytic writing competence in response to different scenarios. In particular, course assignments will cover intensive writing practices in different modes, including description, narration, process, cause-effect, comparison-contrast, definition, and classification.
goals: This class is to help students improve their skills in writing English paragraphs/essays.

**Course description:**

The purpose of this course is to introduce students to the basic structure of a paragraph and its applications to serve various communication purposes . Students will cultivate their skills in paragraph writing through the practice of the following genres: cause and effect, comparison or contrast, definition, division-classification, and argument.

**Textbook:**

**Class Policies:**

1\. Students are expected to **attend each class**—attendance will be taken. Absences of **2 or more times** will result in an automatic failing grade. Lateness is also not     

    allowed.

2\. The medium of instruction will be **English**, and all the in-class activities and communication between the instructor and students will be conducted in **English** only.

3\. Students who miss class are responsible for content. Any student who misses a class has the responsibility for obtaining copies of notes, handouts, assignments, etc.

4\. All typed assignments completed outside of class must follow the **formats** specified in the instructions.

5\. Written assignments must be handed in on time through Moodle.

6.  **No use** of cell phones or electroics are allowed during the class except required by the instructor.

6\. Academic honesty is expected at all times. Plagiarism will result in a serious grade penalty and may lead to an automatic failing grade.
